title: Drivers throw punches in middle of traffic jam in front of shocked onlookers
text:

Two men have been filmed throwing punches at each other in the middle of a traffic jam.

Onlookers were left shocked as the heated exchange unfolded yesterday in Bristol.

Clothes were tugged and fists went flying after the men got out their vehicles and sparked the heated exchange.

The scuffle, which lasted at least 30 seconds, took place at St Philips Causeway while vehicles queued at red lights, reports Bristol Live.

An Audi driver and the passenger of a van took aim at each other's face with wild swings before a third man got out his car to intervene.

Did you see what happened? Email webnews@trinitymirror.com

(Image: Bristol Post)

(Image: Bristol Post)

When the fighting pair calmed down they returned to their respective vehicles - but the Audi driver then cut in front of the van.

Footage of the incident was posted to Facebook and has since gone viral.

Michelle May who shared the video captioned it: "Only in Bristol it's normally the drivers with road rage lol fair play to the guy tho for splitting them up..! [sic]"

(Image: Bristol Post)

(Image: Bristol Post)

One person replied: "Brave bloke splitting them up, good for him."

Another added: "Spot the mobile phone dropping out of the pocket and nobody realised and all drove off. unlucky".

Avon and Somerset Police said this afternoon they had received no calls of an incident from that road.
description: Fists went flying after a van passenger and Audi driver got out their vehicles in the middle of St Philips Causeway, Bristol
